content:
✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: A nice little puzzle. Having those two numbers on one line is no bother when coding in C++, but might take longer to deal with in other languages - I like it ;) Only bad comment is that the C++ solution written could be a lot better and shorter.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Nice idea; not a hard task but may be interesting, especially for Shortest.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: I think the game is easy and fun and fit the kind of games in Clash of code.

The auto-generated code is expecting N and M to be on separate lines, instead of 2 values on the same line.

It is not clear from the description that '"Agent" followed by the agent number' means 'Agent 1' for the first agent, 'Agent 2' for the second agent... instead of the agent's verification number.
When you will fix what he said I will approve the game.

Also Validator 1 has a wrong N value (3 instead of 2).

Considering the task, I don't really like the idea of parsing the codes as ints ("read verification:int" in the stub) as most people — as well as the official solution — will prefer to process them as strings (and also, theoretically, nothing prevents them to contain leading 0s, even though that never happens in the given inputs).

The constraint "N,M < 10" is incorrect (it should be "≤ 10").
